intro: Utricularia longeciliata var. rubrocalcarata, commonly known as the red-veined bladderwort, is a carnivorous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Lentibulariaceae and is characterized by its small, aquatic or semi-aquatic growth habit. The plant features specialized bladder-like structures used to trap and digest small aquatic organisms. Its leaves are typically slender and possess numerous tiny bladders that function as traps. The varietal name "rubrocalcarata" refers to the reddish calcarate structures on its floral parts, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
